article.description: New Mexico steadies past George Mason 69-58
article.headline: New Mexico steadies past George Mason 69-58
article.linkText: New Mexico steadies past George Mason 69-58
article.story: SAN JUAN, Puerto Rico -- Jordan Goodman had 19 points, Deshawn Delaney added 16 and New Mexico held off George Mason 69-58 in the consolation round of the Puerto Rico Tip-Off Friday. New Mexico (3-1) led by nine at the half and maintained that margin for most of the second half, despite the Patriots efforts to cut into it. The Lobos played without point guard Cullen Neal, who was on crutches after spraining his left ankle in their opening round loss to Boston College on Thursday. Shevon Thompson led George Mason (1-3) with 21 points and a tournament record 19 rebounds. The Patriots shot 34 percent for the game, connecting on just 18 of their 53 field goal attempts. New Mexico plays Texas A&M in the consolation final Sunday. George Mason takes on Charleston.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.
